intro: Barbosella kegelii, commonly known as the Kegel's barbosella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Barbosella kegelii is often found in open vegetation types and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
